member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsChannel
member.summary: Provides a way to create and use a TDMS channel.

remarks.para: You can create TDMS channels using . You must specify a channel name and data type, but a description and unit string are optional. You can get and set the channel , , and after the is created. Once you have created a , you can add it to the for your channel group using .

You can use to access the properties associated with this . creates a new collection when it is called, but the collection is not updated if the TDMS file changes on disk. You must call again to update your properties.

Use to write data to the , and and to read data from the channel. The data type of the channel must match the type parameter of and . You can get the data type of the channel using . If you want the data returned as an array, use .

member.seealso: Key Measurement Studio TDMS .NET Library Features

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsChannel.GetData
member.summary: Returns the TDMS channel's data in an object array.
member.returns: An array that holds the TDMS channel data.

exception.para: The has not yet been added to a .
The TDMS channel data type is an unsupported type.
The data type of the channel's data is and the amount of memory required for the array that holds all of the channel's data exceeds the .NET 2GB object memory limit.
The amount of memory required for the returned data array exceeds the amount of memory available.

remarks.para: For all data types except , this method returns all the data in a TDMS channel that will fit in an array without exceeding the .NET 2GB object memory limit. If the total size of data exceeds this limit, the maximum amount of data that can be stored within the array without exceeding the .NET memory limit is returned. If the channel contains no data, an empty array is returned. If the size of the data returned exceeds the amount of memory available, an is thrown.
remarks.note: TDMS files store timing data in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). If the data type of the channel's data is or , by default the time values are converted to local time before they are returned. Set to to get these values in UTC instead of local time.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsChannel.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of a TDMS channel.
member.value: A string that represents the name of a TDMS channel.
member.remarks:
The name of a TDMS channel is stored in the channel's properties as the name property. Call to get a containing all of the channel's properties. The original name of a TDMS channel is used as its identifier. When you change the name property of a TDMS channel, you cannot create a new TDMS channel with the original name.
Setting this property will not change the channel's name shown when viewing the file in DIAdem. DIAdem will display the original name used to create the channel.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsChannelGroup
member.summary: Provides a way to create and use a TDMS channel group.

remarks.para: You can create TDMS channel groups using . You must specify a channel group name, but a description is optional. You can get and set the channel group and after the is created. Once you have created a , you can add it to the for your file using .

Use and to access the channels and properties associated with this . and create new collections when they are called, but are not updated if the TDMS file changes on disk. You must call these methods to update the .

Use , , , and to write and objects to the channels in the channel group. Before writing data, you must add the necessary waveform and timing channels to the channel group. Specify the waveform channel layout using . and only support the and layout modes, and and only support .
Use , , , and to read and objects from the channel group. The channel layout must match the layout specified by . and only support .

exception.para: is not a member of the channel group.

remarks.para: This method appends analog waveform data after existing data on the specified channel. If no data exists on the channel, the analog waveform data is written to the start of the channel. Before calling this method, you must first create and add the required objects to the . If a timing channel is required for the analog waveform data you are appending, it must be added in the order specified by . only supports the and layout modes.
This method determines whether to automatically save your data based on the value of . If is set to and you have made changes to the , you must call before calling this method.
In addition to writing the waveform data and timestamps (if present), this method also adds the following TDMS properties to the channel or channel group:

item.description: Represents the of the channel group.

The number of samples in the most recent appended waveform. This property is added to the waveform channel if it does not already exist. This property is required by TDMS to signify that the channel contains waveform data.
The start time of the waveform. This property is added to the waveform channel.
The offset between the start time of the waveform and the time stamp. This property is added to the waveform channel.
The time interval between samples. This property is added to the waveform channel if for the waveform is .

Timing channels are not supported for writing digital waveform data to a TDMS channel group, so only supports the waveform layout.
This method determines whether to automatically save your data based on the value of . If is set to and you have made changes to the , you must call before calling this method.

The start time of the waveform. This property is added to the waveform channel.
The offset between the start time of the waveform and the time stamp. This property is added to the waveform channel.
The time interval between samples. This property is added to the waveform channel if for the waveform is .
The line number of the digital signal. This property is written to each waveform channel, and the number increases incrementally for each signal.

remarks.para: Each signal in each in is written to a different , starting with the channels specified by . Before calling this method, you must first create and add the required objects to the , one for each digital signal for each waveform. This method appends digital waveform data after existing data on each channel. If no data exists on the channel, the digital waveform data is written to the start of the channel.
Timing channels are not supported for writing digital waveform data to a TDMS channel group, so only supports the waveform layout.

Pass to if you would like to automatically save the associated with the before and after writing the waveform. If an exception occurs during this operation, the data added to the before was called will be saved, but the waveform data will not be saved. The unsaved data may be in an unpredictable state. You can discard the changes by calling followed by to reopen the file. Pass to if you would like to manually save your data. In this case, must be called after the has been modified before you can call .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsChannelGroup.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of a TDMS channel group.
member.value: A string that represents the name of a TDMS channel group. The default value is the name passed in to the constructor.
member.remarks:
The name of a TDMS channel group is stored in the channel group's properties as the name property. Call to get a containing all of the channel group's properties. The original name of a TDMS channel group is used as its identifier. When you change the name property of a TDMS channel group, you cannot create a new TDMS channel group with the original name.
Setting this property will not change the channel group's name shown when viewing the file in DIAdem. DIAdem will display the original name used to create the channel group.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsChannelGroup.WaveformLayout
member.summary: Gets or sets the waveform layout of a TDMS channel group.
member.value: A that represents the layout for the channels in the channel group for reading and writing waveforms. The default value is .
member.exception: The has not yet been added to a .
member.remarks: The value of determines how the channels in the channel group are arranged for reading and writing waveforms. When you create a new channel group for writing waveforms, you must create and add all of its channels and set to the appropriate value before writing waveforms to the channel group.
member.example:
This example will add timing and data channels to a new for the specified number of waveforms. After initialization, you can call to write your waveforms to the returned data channels.
Public Function InitializeAnalogWaveformChannelGroup(ByVal group As TdmsChannelGroup, ByVal waveformDataType As TdmsDataType, ByVal waveformCount As Integer) As TdmsChannel() ' Check if layout requires a timing channel. Dim includeTimingChannel As Boolean Select Case group.WaveformLayout Case TdmsWaveformLayout.NoTimeChannel includeTimingChannel = False Exit Select Case TdmsWaveformLayout.PairedTimeAndSampleChannels includeTimingChannel = True Exit Select Case TdmsWaveformLayout.SingleTimeChannel Case Else Throw New InvalidOperationException("AppendAnalogWaveform methods do not support SingleTimeChannel layout mode.") End Select
' Add timing and data channels for waveforms, as appropriate for the waveform layout. Dim channels As TdmsChannelCollection = group.GetChannels() Dim dataChannels As New List(Of TdmsChannel)() For i As Integer = 0 To waveformCount - 1 If includeTimingChannel Then channels.Add(New TdmsChannel("timing" & i, TdmsDataType.DateTime, "Timing channel for waveform " & i)) End If
Dim dataChannel As New TdmsChannel("data" & i, waveformDataType, "Data channel for waveform " & i) channels.Add(dataChannel) dataChannels.Add(dataChannel) Next group.Parent.Save()
' Return data channels. Return dataChannels.ToArray() End Function

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsFile
member.summary: Provides support for creating new TDMS files and reading from and writing to existing TDMS files.

remarks.para: You can create new TDMS files or open existing files for edit using . You can get and set the file , , , and after the is opened.

Use and to access the channel groups and properties associated with this . and create new collections when they are called, but are not updated if the TDMS file changes on disk. You must call these methods when you want to update .
After writing to the TDMS file, it must be saved before it can be read from again. Use to save changes to the file to disk. Use to close the TDMS file.

Use to defragment a TDMS file on disk. The TDMS file is reorganized on disk so that all the data for each channel is located together. If a file is heavily fragmented then defragmenting the file will speed up read operations.

member.seealso: Key Measurement Studio TDMS .NET Library Features

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsFile.Save
member.summary: Saves the TDMS file to disk.

remarks.para: Any modifications made to TDMS objects, including writing data, are cached until the is saved. If is , the is automatically saved to disk after every change. If is , you must call explicitly to write the cached data to disk. Some operations in the TDMS .NET Library API require the to be saved before the operation can be performed to ensure that all information is up to date.
This method does not close the file. Call to close the handle.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsWaveformLayout
member.summary: Specifies how the waveform channels and any timing channels should be laid out in a .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsWaveformLayout.NoTimeChannel
member.summary: Specifies a waveform layout which does not have a dedicated timing channel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsWaveformLayout.SingleTimeChannel
member.summary: Specifies a waveform layout which has a single dedicated timing channel that applies to one or more waveforms in the channel group. The timing channel must be the first channel in the channel group. This mode is only included for compatibility with other tools that can produce data using this type of layout.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsWaveformLayout.PairedTimeAndSampleChannels
member.summary: Specifies a waveform layout which contains pairs of dedicated timing channels and waveform channels. Each waveform must have its own timing channel, which must come before the waveform channel or channels in the channel group. Use this layout when writing waveforms that have the timing set to .

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsWaveformTimingType
member.summary: Specifies how the timing for a waveform is measured.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsWaveformTimingType.Relative
member.summary: Specifies that the start time for the timing is a relative time stamp.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Tdms.TdmsWaveformTimingType.Absolute
member.summary: Specifies that the start time for the timing is an absolute time stamp.
